alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 1:55PM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grande Ronde River at Troy affecting Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties, Wallowa County and Northeast Blue Mountains zones. .Widespread showers and a few thunderstorms will move across the region this afternoon and evening causing rises on the river over the next couple of days. The Grande Ronde River at Troy has the potential to reach flood stage on Monday. For the Grande Ronde River...including Troy...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Grande Ronde River Troy 10.0 9.1 Sun 1 pm PDT 10.6 10.4 9.3 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ050-WAZ031-032-131200- /O.CON.KPDT.FL.A.0004.220612T2100Z-220615T0130Z/ /TRYO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.UU/ 155 PM PDT Sun Jun 12 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grande Ronde River at Troy. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of fields adjacent to the river from Elgin through Troy and downstream to the confluence of the Snake River. At 11.0 feet, Extensive flooding of fields around Troy are possible, but no residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
